The following circles are the same size. Each is $1$ whole.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/cad12a86efb04e97cbcfcf206dda5c1280684e59)![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/0d785c48e0bc5f252ded051771f77e820434b351)

 
**How many of the pieces in $\red{B}$ do we need to shade so it has the same shaded area as $\blue{A}$?**  [[☃ input-number 2]]
3763111.target:
Följande cirklar har samma storlek. Var och en är $1$ hel.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/cad12a86efb04e97cbcfcf206dda5c1280684e59)![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/0d785c48e0bc5f252ded051771f77e820434b351)

4074318.source:
###Student B's solution

I converted the division problem to a fraction with a denominator of $100$. 

$5 \div 4 = \dfrac{5}{4}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Rewrite the division problem as a fraction}}$

$\phantom{5 \div 2} = \dfrac{5 \times 25}{4 \times 25}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Multiply the top and bottom by 25}}$

$\phantom{5 \div 2} = \dfrac{125}{100}$

$\phantom{5 \div 2} = 1.25$
4074318.target:
###Student B: s lösning

Jag konverterade divisionproblemet till en fraktion med en nämnare av $100$. 

$5 \div 4 = \dfrac{5}{4}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Skriv om delningsproblemet som en fraktion}}$

$\phantom{5 \div 2} = \dfrac{5 \times 25}{4 \times 25}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Multiplicera topp och botten med 25}}$

$\phantom{5 \div 2} = \dfrac{125}{100}$

$\phantom{5 \div 2} = 1.25$

Låt oss skriva om som en fraktion och faktor ut multiplar av $10$:

$10 \div 40 = \dfrac{10}{40}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Skriv om delningsproblemet som en fraktion}}$

4076985.source:
###Student A's solution

I thought in terms of tenths:

$\phantom{=}0.5 - 0.3$

$=5$ tenths $- ~3$ tenths

$=2$ tenths

$=0.2$

tänkt i termer om tiondelar:

$\phantom{=}0.5 - 0.3$

$=5$ tiondelar $- ~3$ tiondelar

$=2$ tiondelar

$=0.2$

4082884.source: A fact family is made up of $3$ numbers that are all related. \n\nFor example, $\\blueD2\\times \\purpleD4 = \\greenD8$, so $\\greenD8\\div\\purpleD4 = \\blueD2$.
4082884.target: En faktafamilj består av $3$ nummer som är relaterade till varandra. \n\nTill exempel $\\blueD2\\times \\purpleD4 = \\greenD8$, så $\\greenD8\\div\\purpleD4 = \\blueD2$.

4082885.source: Remember $8\\times 5$ means $8$ groups of $5$.\n\nIf you're stuck, try skip counting by $5$ eight times.
4082885.target: Kom ihåg $8\\times 5$ betyder $8$ grupper av $5$.\n\nOm du har fastnat, försök hoppa över räkningen med $5$ åtta gånger.

4211714.source:
$\blue{10\dfrac{2}{10}}$ can be regrouped so that the fractional part is **greater** than $\pink{\dfrac{7}{10}}$.

$\begin{align}
\blue{10\dfrac{2}{10}} &= \blue{10+  \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{9+  1 +  \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{9+  \dfrac{10}{10} +  \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{9\dfrac{12}{10}} \\
\end{align}$
4211714.target:
$\blue{10\dfrac{2}{10}}$ kan omgrupperas så att den delade delen är **större** än $\pink{\dfrac{7}{10}}$.

$\begin{align}
\blue{10\dfrac{2}{10}} &= \blue{10+  \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{9+  1 +  \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{9+  \dfrac{10}{10} +  \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{9\dfrac{12}{10}} \\
\end{align}$

4211717.source:
$\blue{6\dfrac{5}{10}}$ can be regrouped so that the fractional part is **greater** than $\pink{\dfrac{9}{10}}$.

$\begin{align}
\blue{6\dfrac{5}{10}} &= \blue{6+  \dfrac{5}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{5+  1 +  \dfrac{5}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{5+  \dfrac{10}{10} +  \dfrac{5}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{5\dfrac{15}{10}} \\
\end{align}$
4211717.target:
$\blue{6\dfrac{5}{10}}$ kan omgrupperas så att den delade delen är **större** än $\pink{\dfrac{9}{10}}$.

$\begin{align}
\blue{6\dfrac{5}{10}} &= \blue{6+  \dfrac{5}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{5+  1 +  \dfrac{5}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{5+  \dfrac{10}{10} +  \dfrac{5}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{5\dfrac{15}{10}} \\
\end{align}$

4211719.source:
$\blue{8\dfrac{1}{8}}$ can be regrouped so that the fractional part is **greater** than $\pink{\dfrac{3}{8}}$.

$\begin{align}
\blue{8\dfrac{1}{8}} &= \blue{8+  \dfrac{1}{8}} \\
\\
&= \blue{7+  1 +  \dfrac{1}{8}} \\
\\
&= \blue{7+  \dfrac{8}{8} +  \dfrac{1}{8}} \\
\\
&= \blue{7\dfrac{9}{8}} 
\end{align}$
4211719.target:
$\blue{8\dfrac{1}{8}}$ kan omgrupperas så att den delade delen är **större** än $\pink{\dfrac{3}{8}}$.

$\begin{align}
\blue{8\dfrac{1}{8}} &= \blue{8+  \dfrac{1}{8}} \\
\\
&= \blue{7+  1 +  \dfrac{1}{8}} \\
\\
&= \blue{7+  \dfrac{8}{8} +  \dfrac{1}{8}} \\
\\
&= \blue{7\dfrac{9}{8}} 
\end{align}$
4211719.note: Context: # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/arithmetic-home/arith-review-fractions/add-sub-mixed-numbers/e/adding-and-subtracting-mixed-numbers-with-like-denominators-2. # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/cc-fourth-grade-math/cc-4th-fractions-topic/cc-4th-add-sub-mixed-numbers/e/adding-and-subtracting-mixed-numbers-with-like-denominators-2. # Exercise at (x1c180609) on the hy stage. # Exercise at (x1c180609) on the pt stage. # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: bg) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: de) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: es) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: hy) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: pt) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: shared) # (format: perseus_text) #: intl/datastore:1

4211721.source:
Because $\green{\dfrac{12}{10}}$ is greater than $1$, it must be converted into a mixed number.

$\begin{align}
\green{\dfrac{12}{10}} &= \green{\dfrac{10}{10} +  \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\\
&= \green{1  \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\end{align}$

Then, we put the $\green{\dfrac{2}{10}}$ under the fractions and the $\green{1}$ with the other whole numbers.

$\begin{align}
&\green{1} \\
&\blue{4} &\blue{\dfrac{6}{10}}\\\\
+&\pink{5}&\pink{\dfrac{6}{10}}\\
\hline{}\\
&&\green{\dfrac{2}{10}}\\
\end{align}$
4211721.target:
Eftersom $\green{\dfrac{12}{10}}$ är större än $1$ gör vi om det till ett tal i blandad form med en heltalsdel.

$\begin{align}
\green{\dfrac{12}{10}} &= \green{\dfrac{10}{10} +  \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\\
&= \green{1  \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\end{align}$

Så tar vi summan och skriver bråkdelen $\green{\dfrac{2}{10}}$ under bråken och heltalet $\green{1}$ med de andra heltalen.

$\begin{align}
&\green{1} \\
&\blue{4} &\blue{\dfrac{6}{10}}\\\\
+&\pink{5}&\pink{\dfrac{6}{10}}\\
\hline{}\\
&&\green{\dfrac{2}{10}}\\
\end{align}$
4211721.note: Context: # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/arithmetic-home/arith-review-fractions/add-sub-mixed-numbers/e/adding-and-subtracting-mixed-numbers-with-like-denominators-2. # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/cc-fourth-grade-math/cc-4th-fractions-topic/cc-4th-add-sub-mixed-numbers/e/adding-and-subtracting-mixed-numbers-with-like-denominators-2. # Exercise at (x1c180609) on the hy stage. # Exercise at (x1c180609) on the pt stage. # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: bg) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: de) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: es) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: hy) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: pt) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: shared) # (format: perseus_text) #: intl/datastore:1

4211722.source:
Because $\green{\dfrac{12}{8}}$ is greater than $1$, it must be converted into a mixed number.

$\begin{align}
\green{\dfrac{12}{8}} &= \green{\dfrac{8}{8} +  \dfrac{4}{8}} \\
\\
&= \green{1  \dfrac{4}{8}} \\
\end{align}$

Then, we put the $\green{\dfrac{4}{8}}$ under the fractions and the $\green{1}$ with the other whole numbers.

$\begin{align}
&\green{1} \\
&\blue{2} &\blue{\dfrac{5}{8}}\\\\
+&\pink{4}&\pink{\dfrac{7}{8}}\\
\hline{}\\
&&\green{\dfrac{4}{8}}\\
\end{align}$
4211722.target:
Eftersom $\green{\dfrac{12}{8}}$ är större än $1$ gör vi om det till ett tal i blandad form med en heltalsdel.

$\begin{align}
\green{\dfrac{12}{8}} &= \green{\dfrac{8}{8} +  \dfrac{4}{8}} \\
\\
&= \green{1  \dfrac{4}{8}} \\
\end{align}$

Så tar vi summan och skriver bråkdelen $\green{\dfrac{4}{8}}$ under bråken och heltalet $\green{1}$ med de andra heltalen.

$\begin{align}
&\green{1} \\
&\blue{2} &\blue{\dfrac{5}{8}}\\\\
+&\pink{4}&\pink{\dfrac{7}{8}}\\
\hline{}\\
&&\green{\dfrac{4}{8}}\\
\end{align}$

$\begin{align}
&\blue{2} &\blue{\dfrac{5}{8}}\\\\
+&\pink{4}&\pink{\dfrac{7}{8}}\\
\hline{}\\
&&\green{\dfrac{12}{8}}\\
\end{align}$
4211729.target:
Vi ställer upp talen i blandad form med heltalsdelarna till vänster och bråkdelarna till höger. Sedan börjar vi med att addera bråkdelarna:

$\begin{align}
&\blue{2} &\blue{\dfrac{5}{8}}\\\\
+&\pink{4}&\pink{\dfrac{7}{8}}\\
\hline{}\\
&&\green{\dfrac{12}{8}}\\
\end{align}$

4211731.source:
We can line up the mixed numbers by their whole number parts and fractional parts, and then look at the fractions first.  

$\begin{align}
&\blue{10} &\blue{\dfrac{2}{10}}\\\\
-&\pink{3}&\pink{\dfrac{7}{10}}\\
\hline{}\\
\end{align}$

We can't subtract $\blue{\dfrac{2}{10}} - \pink{\dfrac{7}{10}}$, because $\blue{\dfrac{2}{10}}$ is **less** than $\pink{\dfrac{7}{10}}$.
4211731.target:
Vi kan ställa upp de blandade siffrorna med deras hela antal delar och fraktioner, och titta sedan på fraktionerna först.  

$\begin{align}
&\blue{10} &\blue{\dfrac{2}{10}}\\\\
-&\pink{3}&\pink{\dfrac{7}{10}}\\
\hline{}\\
\end{align}$

Vi kan inte subtrahera $\blue{\dfrac{2}{10}} - \pink{\dfrac{7}{10}}$eftersom $\blue{\dfrac{2}{10}}$ är **mindre** än $\pink{\dfrac{7}{10}}$.
4211731.note: Context: # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/arithmetic-home/arith-review-fractions/add-sub-mixed-numbers/e/adding-and-subtracting-mixed-numbers-with-like-denominators-2. # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/cc-fourth-grade-math/cc-4th-fractions-topic/cc-4th-add-sub-mixed-numbers/e/adding-and-subtracting-mixed-numbers-with-like-denominators-2. # Exercise at (x1c180609) on the hy stage. # Exercise at (x1c180609) on the pt stage. # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: bg) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: de) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: es) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: hy) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: pt) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: shared) # (format: perseus_text) #: intl/datastore:1

4211732.source:
We can line up the mixed numbers by their whole number parts and fractional parts, and then subtract the fractions first:

$\begin{align}
&\blue{8} &\blue{\dfrac{1}{8}}\\\\
-&\pink{3}&\pink{\dfrac{3}{8}}\\
\hline\end{align}$

We can't subtract $\blue{\dfrac{1}{8}} - \pink{\dfrac{3}{8}}$, because $\blue{\dfrac{1}{8}}$ is **less** than $\pink{\dfrac{3}{8}}$.
4211732.target:
Vi kan ställa in de blandade talen med deras hela antal delar och fraktioner, och sedan subtrahera fraktionerna först:

$\begin{align}
&\blue{8} &\blue{\dfrac{1}{8}}\\\\
-&\pink{3}&\pink{\dfrac{3}{8}}\\
\hline\end{align}$

Vi kan inte subtrahera $\blue{\dfrac{1}{8}} - \pink{\dfrac{3}{8}}$eftersom $\blue{\dfrac{1}{8}}$ är **mindre** än $\pink{\dfrac{3}{8}}$.
